page.title: 07MRS FLAVELL,BAGINTON.
page.content: Mrs Flavell(85) a resident for 62years recalls the changes.In the past Bagin ton was a small village of a few cott ages. In 1925 bungalows were built which attracted more people. Earlier there was only one shop occupying a tin hut,later two shops and some house s were added.This was called 'Market Corner'.The school was built about 1836.Lucy Price was the school's found er. The schoolmistress Miss Boswell, lived in the school above the infants classroom.The magnificent Baginton hall, owned by Sir William Bromley Davenport, a speaker in the House of Commons,was the half way house between London and Capesthorne.In the Hall's stables was a chapel where the C.ofE. services were held.World War 2 caused great damage, bombs were dropped and the nearby airfield was used for mili tary purposes. cont'd.......
